  <meta content="This morning, the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus go on sale around the world. Those four million of you who pre-ordered an iPhone 6 or 6 Plus should hopefully receive your new, curvier, large-screen smartphone today. If you opted for queuing up outside your local Apple store, I hope you managed to get your hands on an iPhone before they ran out of stock. Read on for the first teardowns, drop tests, and some photos of some very long Apple store lines." property="og:description"/>

	    __EXTECH.parseQuerystring = __EXTECH.parseQuerystring || function (url) {
	           var q = {};
	           if (!url) {
	                 return {};
	           }
	            url.replace(/([^?=&amp;]+)(=([^&amp;]*))?/g, function ($0, $1, $2, $3) { q[$1] = $3; });
	            return q;
	  };

  </script>
  <link href="http://www.extremetech.com/xmlrpc.php?rsd" rel="EditURI" title="RSD" type="application/rsd+xml"/>
  <link href="http://www.extremetech.com/wp-includes/wlwmanifest.xml" rel="wlwmanifest" type="application/wlwmanifest+xml"/>
  <link href="http://www.extremetech.com/mobile/190242-5-awesome-features-of-your-new-iphone-6" rel="prev" title="The 5 best features of your new iPhone 6"/>
  <link href="http://www.extremetech.com/extreme/190555-this-nuclear-battery-could-power-your-smartphone-forever-as-long-as-you-dont-value-your-life-or-sperm-count-too-highly" rel="next" title="This nuclear battery could power your smartphone forever  as long as you dont value your life or sperm count too highly"/>
  <link href="http://www.extremetech.com/computing/190532-iphone-6-and-iphone-6-plus-launch-day-teardowns-drop-tests-long-lines-and-more" rel="canonical"/>
  <link href="http://www.extremetech.com/?p=190532" rel="shortlink"/>
  <!-- Dynamic Widgets v1.5.6.1 by QURL - http://www.qurl.nl //-->
  <!--Inside Body Tags -->
  <div class="widget tags widget_execphp" id="execphp-43">
   <script type="text/javascript">
    window._taboola = window._taboola || [];
  _taboola.push({article:'auto'});
  !function (e, f, u) {
    e.async = 1;
    e.src = u;
    f.parentNode.insertBefore(e, f);
  }(document.createElement('script'),
  document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0],
  'http://cdn.taboola.com/libtrc/ziffdavis-network15-extremetech/loader.js');
   </script>
  </div>
  <div class="widget tags widget_execphp" id="execphp-39">
   <script type="text/javascript">
    window.ZDVOptions = {
  onViewed: function(ad) {
  if (ad.containerId === "TopBanner") {
      if ((ad.size === "728x90" || ad.size === "970x250") ){
         __ETSTICKY.Unsticky();
         console.log("** Banner ad is released");
      }
    }
  if (ad.containerId === "TopMpu") {
      if ((ad.size === "300x250" || ad.size === "300x600") ){
         __ETSTICKY.UnstickyMedrect();
         console.log("** Medrect ad is released");
      }
    }
  }
}
   </script>
   <script async="true" src="//static.ziffdavis.com/jst/zdvtools.min.js" type="text/javascript">
   </script>
  </div>
  <div class="widget tags widget_execphp" id="execphp-16">
   <!-- Begin comScore Tag -->
   <script>
    var _comscore = _comscore || [];

  (function() {
    var s = document.createElement("script"), el = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0]; s.async = true;
    s.src = (document.location.protocol == "https:" ? "https://sb" : "http://b") + ".scorecardresearch.com/beacon.js";

  })();
   </script>
   <noscript>
    <img src="http://b.scorecardresearch.com/p?c1=2&amp;c2=6036202&amp;cv=2.0&amp;cj=1"/>

  </div>
  <div class="widget tags widget_execphp" id="execphp-38">

document.write("trac.record().post();");

} else {

document.write("(function () {");

document.write("      d.onerror = d.onload = null;");
document.write("};");
document.write("    d.src = [\"http://secure-us.imrworldwide.com/cgi-bin/m?ci=us-806031h&amp;cg=0&amp;cc=1&amp;si=\", escape(window.location.href), \"&amp;rp=\", escape(document.referrer), \"&amp;ts=compact&amp;rnd=\", (new Date()).getTime()].join('');");

   </script>
   <noscript>
    <div>
     <img alt="" height="1" src="http://secure-us.imrworldwide.com/cgi-bin/m?ci=us-806031h&amp;cg=0&amp;cc=1&amp;ts=noscript" width="1"/>
    </div>
   </noscript>
   <!-- END Nielsen Online SiteCensus V6.0 -->
  </div>

       <div class="lboard">
        <div class="topad">
         <style type="text/css">
          #stickybanner,
#stickybanner #stickyheader {z-index:99998;}

.zifftywallpaper_right{top:100px !important;}
         </style>
         <div class="adContainer" id="TopBanner">
          <script type="text/javascript">
           googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('TopBanner'); });
          </script>
          <noscript>
           <a href="http://pubads.g.doubleclick.net/gampad/jump?iu=/4585/zd.extech/computingsection_ATF&amp;t=zdid%3D190532%26cmn%3Dzd&amp;sz=970x250|728x90&amp;template=article&amp;c=9582416&amp;tile=1">
            <img src="http://pubads.g.doubleclick.net/gampad/ad?iu=/4585/zd.extech/computingsection_ATF&amp;t=zdid%3D190532%26cmn%3Dzd&amp;sz=970x250|728x90&amp;template=article&amp;c=9582416&amp;tile=1"/>

     <div id="main">
      <div class="add-nav">
       <ul class="breadcrumbs" id="breadcrumbs">
        <!-- Breadcrumb NavXT 5.1.1 -->
        <li class="home">
         <a href="http://www.extremetech.com" title="Go to ExtremeTech.">
          ExtremeTech
         </a>
        </li>
        <li>
         <span typeof="v:Breadcrumb">
          <a class="taxonomy category" href="http://www.extremetech.com/category/computing" property="v:title" rel="v:url" title="Go to the Computing category archives.">
           Computing
          </a>
         </span>
        </li>
        <li class="current_item">
         iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus launch day: Teardowns, drop tests, long lines, and more
        </li>
       </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="twocolumns">
       <div id="content">
        <div class="article">
         <div class="title">
          <h2>
           iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus launch day: Teardowns, drop tests, long lines, and more
          </h2>
          <ul>
           <li>
            <span class="by vcard">
             By
             <a href="http://www.extremetech.com/author/santhony" rel="author" title="Posts by Sebastian Anthony">
              Sebastian Anthony
             </a>
             on September 19, 2014 at 9:30 am
            </span>
           </li>
           <li class="comments">
            <a data-disqus-identifier="190532 http://www.extremetech.com/?p=190532" href="http://www.extremetech.com/computing/190532-iphone-6-and-iphone-6-plus-launch-day-teardowns-drop-tests-long-lines-and-more#disqus_thread">
             <span>
              Comment
             </span>
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
          <span id="intelliTXT" name="intellitxt">
           <img alt="iPhone 6 Plus teardown, iFixit" class="attachment-full wp-post-image" height="353" src="http://www.extremetech.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/iphone-6-plus-teardown-640x353.jpg" width="640"/>
           <div class="photo">
            <div class="box2">
             <h3>
              Share This article
             </h3>
             <div class="addthis_sharing_toolbox">
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <p>
            This morning, the iPhone 6
            <a class="zdcse" data-affiliate-ziffcat="22654">
            </a>
            and iPhone 6 Plus
            <a class="zdcse" data-affiliate-ziffcat="22656">
            </a>
            go on sale around the world. Those
            <a href="http://www.extremetech.com/computing/190085-iphone-6-and-6-plus-break-pre-order-record-android-was-right-about-large-screens">
             four million of you
            </a>
            who pre-ordered an iPhone 6 or 6 Plus should hopefully receive your new, curvier, large-screen smartphone today.If you opted for queuing up outside your local Apple store, I hope you managed to get your hands on an iPhone before they ran out of stock. While Im sure most of you bought a new iPhone 6 or 6 Plus because
            <em>
             you wanted a new phone
            </em>
            , there are other people out there 
            <em>
             evil technophiles
            </em>
             who rushed home to disassemble Apples latest masterpiece, or to drop it on concrete to see just how tough that non-sapphire screen is.
           </p>
           <p>
            Yes, just a few hours after the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus went on sale, we have the first teardowns and drop tests. Read on for some glorious photos of the iPhone 6s innards  and some very impressive drop test results.
           </p>
           <h3>
            iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus teardowns
           </h3>
           <p>
            Like clockwork, our friends at
            <a href="https://www.ifixit.com/Teardown/iPhone+6+Teardown/29213">
             iFixit
            </a>
            headed over to Australia to get a new iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus before the rest of the English-speaking world woke up. Neither teardown revealed anything particularly exciting  but its notablethat both the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus received fairly high repairability scores (6 and 7 out of 10 respectively).
           </p>
           <div class="wp-caption alignnone" id="attachment_190545" style="width: 650px">
            <a href="http://www.extremetech.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/iphone-6-plus-battery.jpg">
             <img alt="The massive iPhone 6 Plus battery" class="size-large wp-image-190545" height="480" src="http://www.extremetech.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/iphone-6-plus-battery-640x480.jpg" width="640"/>
            </a>
            <p class="wp-caption-text">
             The massive iPhone 6 Plus battery, clocking in at 2,915 mAh [Image credit: iFixit]
            </p>
           </div>
           <p>
            The teardowns reveal that the iPhone 6 has a fairly small 1,810 mAh battery  up from 1,560 mAh on the iPhone 5S. The iPhone 6 Plus, however, has a monstrous 2,915 mAh (11.1 Wh) battery  larger even than the Galaxy S5s 2,800 mAh. This is why, despite having a larger screen,
            <a href="http://www.extremetech.com/computing/190312-iphone-6-plus-review-round-up-like-a-mini-ipad-mini-but-with-a-better-camera">
             the iPhone 6 Plus has superior battery life
            </a>
            to the iPhone 6. (Still, we wonder if Apple couldve put a larger battery in the iPhone 6, but chose not to.)
           </p>
           <div class="wp-caption alignnone" id="attachment_190543" style="width: 650px">
            <a href="http://www.extremetech.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/iphone-6-a8-logic-board.jpg">
             <img alt="The main logic board in the iPhone 6" class="size-large wp-image-190543" height="352" src="http://www.extremetech.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/iphone-6-a8-logic-board-640x352.jpg" width="640"/>
            </a>
            <p class="wp-caption-text">
             The main logic board in the iPhone 6. The iPhone 6 Plus is almost identical. [Image credit:
             <a href="https://www.ifixit.com/Teardown/iPhone+6+Teardown/29213">
              iFixit
             </a>
             ]
            </p>
           </div>
           <p>
            Otherwise, both the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus seem to have the same complement of chips and components. Theres the same A8 APL1011 SoC, the same Qualcomm MDM9625M modem, the same NXP M8 motion coprocessor, the same NXP NFC module and secure element.
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Read:
             <a href="http://www.extremetech.com/computing/189787-apples-a8-soc-analyzed-the-iphone-6-chip-is-a-2-billion-transistor-20nm-monster">
              Apples A8 SoC analyzed: The iPhone 6 chip is a 2-billion-transistor 20nm monster
             </a>
            </strong>
           </p>
           <p>
            The iPhone 6 Plus, other than its obvious size, display, and battery differences, only really has one other feature that the iPhone 6 lacks: a rear camera module with optical image stabilization (OIS).
           </p>
           <p>
            Overall, iFixit is pleased with the design decisions and repairability of both phones. The screen on both the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus is fairly easy to replace, as is the battery. Youll still need a proprietary pentalobe screwdriver though.
           </p>
           <h3>
            iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus drop tests
           </h3>
           <p>
            As a lover of technology, I personally find it a bit upsetting that people buy state-of-the-art gadgets, only to rush outside and intentionally drop them on the floor. Still, if youve just bought an iPhone 6 or iPhone 6 Plus, I guess its kind of helpful to know how rugged your device is  maybe itll help you decide whether to put a case on your new phone or not.
           </p>
           <p>
            Anyway, here are two videos of the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 being drop tested:
           </p>
           <p>
            <iframe allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" frameborder="0" height="360" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/JS8f-hVsDzA" width="640">
            </iframe>
           </p>
           <p>
            <iframe allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" frameborder="0" height="360" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/eGxlm82hWDM" width="640">
            </iframe>
           </p>
           <p>
            Its obviously hard to proclaim any kind of authoritative result from two videos, but it does seem that the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus arepretty resistant to drop damage and smashed screens. The first video is particularly impressive  but the second video, where an edge impact smashes the screen, makes you wonder if the first guy just got lucky.
           </p>
           <p>
            Also, Im impressed at how high-tech drop tests are nowadays  look at the number of cameras that the first drop tester uses! Marvel at the apparatus that the second drop tester uses to ensure a fair and balanced meeting with its maker.
           </p>
           <h3>
            iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus Apple store lines around the world
           </h3>
           <p>
            Amusingly enough, the first iPhone 6 drop test was actually carried out by a young bloke in Australia, who unboxed his new fondleslab in front of a TV reporter  and then let it fall unceremoniously to the floor. Youll be glad to hear that his screen did not smash.
           </p>
           <p>
            <iframe allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" frameborder="0" height="360" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/YbehPQfu3K0" width="640">
            </iframe>
           </p>
           <p>
            And finally,here are some photos of Apple fans lining up around the world.
           </p>
           <div class="wp-caption alignnone" id="attachment_190538" style="width: 650px">
            <a href="http://www.extremetech.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/iphone-6-queue-highland-village.jpg">
             <img alt="iPhone 6 line at Highland Village, Houston -- where it's raining [Image credit: Houston Chronicle]" class="size-large wp-image-190538" height="426" src="http://www.extremetech.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/iphone-6-queue-highland-village-640x426.jpg" width="640"/>
            </a>
            <p class="wp-caption-text">
             iPhone 6 line at Highland Village, Houston  where its raining [Image credit: Houston Chronicle]
            </p>
           </div>
           <div style="background-color:#fff;display:inline-block;font-family:'Helvetica Neue',Arial,sans-serif;color:#a7a7a7;font-size:11px;width:100%;max-width:594px;">
            <div style="overflow:hidden;position:relative;height:0;padding:66.498316% 0 0 0;width:100%;">
             <iframe frameborder="0" height="395" scrolling="no" src="//embed.gettyimages.com/embed/455694608?et=vgcfKyJiT1VBOdlQpSTIww&amp;sig=lk-2xX_uo8QrIcWXMxClfcy7rvosIJUcZywXLEF_xQ0=" style="display:inline-block;position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:100%;height:100%;" width="594">
             </iframe>
            </div>
            <p style="margin:0;">
            </p>
            <div style="padding:0;margin:0 0 0 10px;text-align:left;">
             <a href="http://www.gettyimages.com/detail/455694608" style="color:#a7a7a7;text-decoration:none;font-weight:normal !important;border:none;display:inline-block;" target="_blank">
              #455694608
             </a>
             /
             <a href="http://www.gettyimages.com" style="color:#a7a7a7;text-decoration:none;font-weight:normal !important;border:none;display:inline-block;" target="_blank">
              gettyimages.com
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div style="background-color:#fff;display:inline-block;font-family:'Helvetica Neue',Arial,sans-serif;color:#a7a7a7;font-size:11px;width:100%;max-width:594px;">
            <div style="overflow:hidden;position:relative;height:0;padding:66.498316% 0 0 0;width:100%;">
             <iframe frameborder="0" height="395" scrolling="no" src="//embed.gettyimages.com/embed/455694322?et=1Xy43z8xTphR7owbgbe83A&amp;sig=VrWH76Bpsjd5p97g5Qe34udCd7OfIL3uR7sJqf7cXfQ=" style="display:inline-block;position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:100%;height:100%;" width="594">
             </iframe>
            </div>
            <p style="margin:0;">
            </p>
            <div style="padding:0;margin:0 0 0 10px;text-align:left;">
             <a href="http://www.gettyimages.com/detail/455694322" style="color:#a7a7a7;text-decoration:none;font-weight:normal !important;border:none;display:inline-block;" target="_blank">
              #455694322
             </a>
             /
             <a href="http://www.gettyimages.com" style="color:#a7a7a7;text-decoration:none;font-weight:normal !important;border:none;display:inline-block;" target="_blank">
              gettyimages.com
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="wp-caption alignnone" id="attachment_190540" style="width: 650px">
            <a href="http://www.extremetech.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/iphone-6-grand-central-north.jpg">
             <img alt="iPhone 6 Grand Central line" class="size-large wp-image-190540" height="480" src="http://www.extremetech.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/iphone-6-grand-central-north-640x480.jpg" width="640"/>
            </a>
            <p class="wp-caption-text">
             This is apparently the line for the Apple store at Grand Central Terminal in NYC  six blocks from the actual store [Image credit:
             <a href="https://twitter.com/jbwphoto/status/512952607040892928/photo/1">
              Jay Wilson
             </a>
             ]
            </p>
           </div>
           <div style="background-color:#fff;display:inline-block;font-family:'Helvetica Neue',Arial,sans-serif;color:#a7a7a7;font-size:11px;width:100%;max-width:594px;">
            <div style="overflow:hidden;position:relative;height:0;padding:66.666667% 0 0 0;width:100%;">
             <iframe frameborder="0" height="396" scrolling="no" src="//embed.gettyimages.com/embed/181298183?et=4qpFD_JvRHp0jb5ugVMIlg&amp;sig=yR5rRHgo6VzaKhaq0Kdqhc5Hgq_HgzwoAnt3jPD9CGY=" style="display:inline-block;position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:100%;height:100%;" width="594">
             </iframe>
            </div>
            <p style="margin:0;">
            </p>
            <div style="padding:0;margin:0 0 0 10px;text-align:left;">
             <a href="http://www.gettyimages.com/detail/181298183" style="color:#a7a7a7;text-decoration:none;font-weight:normal !important;border:none;display:inline-block;" target="_blank">
              #181298183
             </a>
             /
             <a href="http://www.gettyimages.com" style="color:#a7a7a7;text-decoration:none;font-weight:normal !important;border:none;display:inline-block;" target="_blank">
              gettyimages.com
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
           <p>
            Remember, these guys will probably be queuing up yet again next month for the new iPad Air and then a couple of months after that, for the new Apple Watch.
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             If youve just picked up your own iPhone 6 or 6 Plus, read our storyabout
             <a href="http://www.extremetech.com/mobile/190333-ios-8-the-best-new-features-plus-a-few-hidden-ones-you-might-not-have-found-yet" title="iOS 8: The best new features, plus a few hidden gems you might not have found yet">
              the best (and hidden) features of iOS 8
             </a>
              or
             <a href="http://www.extremetech.com/mobile/190242-5-awesome-features-of-your-new-iphone-6" title="The 5 best features of your new iPhone 6">
              the best features of the new iPhone 6
             </a>
             .
            </strong>
           </p>
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="articles-list">
          <div class="holder">
           <div class="widget column widget_execphp" id="execphp-45">

                         </p>

              <li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="dsq-comment-331826">
               <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-331826">
                <cite id="dsq-cite-331826">
                 <span id="dsq-author-user-331826">
                  AdamRadzik22
                 </span>
                </cite>
               </div>
               <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-331826">
                <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-331826">
                 <p>
                  I still just cannot fathom why people are willing to line up like that and wait for days and/or many many hours for a phone.  Other than bragging rights, nothing (literally) will go different in their lives if they have it within the first few hours of availability versus on Day 2.  Though, I guess if youre worried about the item being in stock, that needs to be taken into account.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  But still
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
               <ul class="children">
                <li class="comment odd alt depth-2" id="dsq-comment-331827">
                 <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-331827">
                  <cite id="dsq-cite-331827">
                   <span id="dsq-author-user-331827">
                    massau
                   </span>
                  </cite>
                 </div>
                 <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-331827">
                  <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-331827">
                   <p>
                    even if you wait a week it wouldnt be bad at all end you will be 100% sure the phone works perfectly and would be an decent upgrade because reviews would have been out by then.
                   </p>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <ul class="children">
                  <li class="comment even depth-3" id="dsq-comment-331842">
                   <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-331842">
                    <cite id="dsq-cite-331842">
                     <span id="dsq-author-user-331842">
                      Marco
                     </span>
                    </cite>
                   </div>
                   <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-331842">
                    <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-331842">
                     <p>
                      Or even a year (gasp)!  As much as I like tech, I enjoy my time and sanity far more than the latest and greatest tech in my hand.  Ill always buy 2nd or 3rd tier tech because that is the financial sweet spot, and because it gives time for others to review and test those things (and find the problems) before I have to consider buying it.  If we all bought cars like we do phones, wed see a ton of new Ferraris about on the roads all the time.  Me, I prefer to allocate resources differently, and do so in all things in life.  But to each his own, right?
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Im never sorry that someone else paid for bleeding edge stuff, so I can have cheaper and better stuff a year or two later.  I understand the physiological structures, psychological forces, and base urges at play in our brains that influence people to spend their money illogically, and Im more than happy to take full advantage of that, letting others slave themselves for the newest tech.  So yeah, go run out and get it!  =)
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                   <ul class="children">
                    <li class="comment odd alt depth-4" id="dsq-comment-331940">

                        do really i need this?
                        <br/>
                        yes, is it an improvement over what i already have?
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        yes, is it worth the price?
                        <br/>
                        if yes buy it else no.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        the only thing i find sad are blokes with the latest gadgets which never have the money even worse are the ones why sell there kidneys.
                       </p>
                      </div>

                 <ul class="children">
                  <li class="comment odd alt depth-3" id="dsq-comment-331914">
                   <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-331914">
                    <cite id="dsq-cite-331914">
                     <span id="dsq-author-user-331914">
                      bmwman91
                     </span>
                    </cite>
                   </div>
                   <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-331914">
                    <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-331914">
                     <p>
                      Its all good if people are excited about the new phone and want to go try to get a first crack at it. However, being able to stand inline for a day to spend what is a months salary in many parts of the world on a fun new gadget is a LUXURY and PRIVILEGE, not difficulty and pain. Volunteering to stand in line for something that could easily be delivered to your door and then trying to claim that it was difficult is a textbook example of a contrivance, and it makes me embarrassed for America that we have gotten so soft.
                     </p>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                   <ul class="children">

              <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="dsq-comment-332120">
               <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-332120">
                <cite id="dsq-cite-332120">
                 <span id="dsq-author-user-332120">
                  Nevsky2
                 </span>
                </cite>
               </div>
               <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-332120">
                <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-332120">
                 <p>
                  Sticking with my OnePlus at $349.  Similar specs and less than half the price.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </li>
              <!-- #comment-## -->
              <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="dsq-comment-332307">
               <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-332307">
                <cite id="dsq-cite-332307">
                 <span id="dsq-author-user-332307">
                  Technibility
                 </span>
                </cite>
               </div>
               <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-332307">
                <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-332307">
                 <p>
                  Smashed on launch after being first at Apple Store
                  <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H0ork7rSAEQ" rel="nofollow">
                   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H0ork7rSAEQ
                  </a>
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </li>
              <!-- #comment-## -->
              <li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="dsq-comment-332590">
               <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-332590">
                <cite id="dsq-cite-332590">
                 <span id="dsq-author-user-332590">
                  emrahatilkan
                 </span>
                </cite>
               </div>
               <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-332590">
                <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-332590">
                 <p>
                  I am waiting in the line to get iPhone 7. I have nothing to do.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </li>
              <!-- #comment-## -->
              <li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="dsq-comment-332652">
               <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-332652">
                <cite id="dsq-cite-332652">
                 <span id="dsq-author-user-332652">
                  GruesomeFireFighter
                 </span>
                </cite>
               </div>
               <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-332652">
                <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-332652">
                 <p>
                  Worship the holy apple.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  The apple way, selling over expensive crap to stupid consumers that like to
                  <br/>
                  get robbed.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  This has been a disastrous launch in every respect. The iwatch is such an
                  <br/>
                  ugly piece of crap, it is truly unbelievable how a company, formerly known for
                  <br/>
                  its remarkable design, dares to put out such a crap ton of shit. Some
                  <br/>
                  characteristics are glaringly obvious and inherent to it: over expensive,
                  <br/>
                  hardly innovative, limited functionality and usability (need of an iPhone to
                  <br/>
                  make it work), looks exactly like a toy watch and so on.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  There are of course way better smart watches out there, especially form the
                  <br/>
                  likes of Samsung, Sony, Motorola, Asus, LG, simply put, there is no need for
                  <br/>
                  another piece of over expensive junk.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  The iPhone 6 is technologically stuck in pre-2011 times, a base model with
                  <br/>
                  a capacity of 16GB without the possibility to use SD cards isnt even funny
                  <br/>
                  anymore. The screen resolution is horrendous, it isnt water proof, shock and
                  <br/>
                  dust resistant, it offers nothing innovative, just some incremental
                  <br/>
                  updates over its predecessor, both lacking severely behind their competitors at
                  <br/>
                  their respective launch dates.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Now the Iphone 6 Plus offers a Retina HD screen, full 1920x1080p, oh wow,
                  <br/>
                  where have you been for the past 4 years apple, talk about trailing behind.
                  <br/>
                  Thats pathetic. The interesting thing about that is the fact that apple
                  <br/>
                  always manages to sell backwards oriented, outdated crap to its user base, all
                  <br/>
                  while pretending to be an innovative technology leader. The similarities
                  <br/>
                  regarding any form of sectarian cult are striking.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  You gotta love how Apple always comes up with new marketing bullshit terms,
                  <br/>
                  aka Retina HD, with the intention to manipulate its users while preventing easy
                  <br/>
                  comparisons with its competitors by withholding the actual specs. Apparently its
                  <br/>
                  not enough to have a 1080p screen, you have to call it Retina HD to make those
                  <br/>
                  suckers buy it, otherwise someone could look at the 4K Amoled and Oled screens
                  <br/>
                  form LG and Samsung devices and get outright disappointed. Same goes for
                  <br/>
                  everything else. Every outdated feature needs to get its own marketing label
                  <br/>
                  to persuade buyers with crappy experience and usability ads, while covering
                  <br/>
                  the truth with marketing gibberish, knowing full well that only a fraction of
                  <br/>
                  aforementioned buyers cares to look at the facts and dares to compare them.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Car engines come to mind. For comparisons shake lets look at a 1.0 liter, turbo
                  <br/>
                  charged petrol engine and a V8 compressor. Whats better should be obvious, but
                  <br/>
                  by calling the former an ecobooster, thus giving it a special marketing label,
                  <br/>
                  this joke becomes a feature, something positive that can be added tot the list
                  <br/>
                  of features of a car.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  By doing so a negative aspect is transformed into a positive one, the
                  <br/>
                  reality is distorted, non tech savvy buyers are manipulated and comparisons are
                  <br/>
                  made more difficult (another layer of marketing bullshit to overcome), well done
                  <br/>
                  marketing department. You see , if something is seriously lacking (of course for
                  <br/>
                  profit, what else), dont bother explaining, just give it a nice marketing term, distort
                  <br/>
                  reality, make it a feature and call it a day. Fuck that!!
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  The Apple Iphone 1 and Ipad 1 might have been innovative at their time,
                  <br/>
                  but since then, the bitten apple has been continuously rotting from the inside
                  <br/>
                  outwards, always swarmed by millions of Iworms which regale themselves with its
                  <br/>
                  rotten flesh, not forgetting all other Americans who support apple by means of
                  <br/>
                  their tax dollars to finance its bought US Treasury/Government bond interest rates.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Last but not least, every Apple product includes a direct hotlink to the NSA,
                  <br/>
                  free of charge, something that might make it a good value, after all.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Ceterum censeo Applem esse delendam.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
               <ul class="children">
                <li class="comment even depth-2" id="dsq-comment-332658">
                 <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-332658">
                  <cite id="dsq-cite-332658">
                   <span id="dsq-author-user-332658">
                    Quenepas
                   </span>
                  </cite>
                 </div>
                 <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-332658">
                  <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-332658">
                   <p>
                    tl;dr I hate Apple because its cool cause Im edgy and stuff.
                   </p>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </li>
                <!-- #comment-## -->
                <li class="comment odd alt depth-2" id="dsq-comment-332800">
                 <div class="dsq-comment-header" id="dsq-comment-header-332800">
                  <cite id="dsq-cite-332800">
                   <span id="dsq-author-user-332800">
                    Dan
                   </span>
                  </cite>
                 </div>
                 <div class="dsq-comment-body" id="dsq-comment-body-332800">
                  <div class="dsq-comment-message" id="dsq-comment-message-332800">
                   <p>
                    Youre a moron if you think Google and the NSA arent buddies either. Also, calm down bro.
                   </p>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </li>
                <!-- #comment-## -->
               </ul>
               <!-- .children -->
              </li>
              <!-- #comment-## -->
             </ul>
            </div>
           </div>
           <script type="text/javascript">
            /* &lt;![CDATA[ */
    var disqus_url = 'http://www.extremetech.com/computing/190532-iphone-6-and-iphone-6-plus-launch-day-teardowns-drop-tests-long-lines-and-more';
    var disqus_identifier = '190532 http://www.extremetech.com/?p=190532';
    var disqus_container_id = 'disqus_thread';
    var disqus_domain = 'disqus.com';
    var disqus_shortname = 'extremetech';
    var disqus_title = "iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus launch day: Teardowns, drop tests, long lines, and more";
        var disqus_config = function () {
        var config = this; // Access to the config object
        config.language = '';

        /*
           All currently supported events:
            * preData  fires just before we request for initial data
            * preInit - fires after we get initial data but before we load any dependencies
            * onInit  - fires when all dependencies are resolved but before dtpl template is rendered
            * afterRender - fires when template is rendered but before we show it
            * onReady - everything is done
         */

        config.callbacks.preData.push(function() {
            // clear out the container (its filled for SEO/legacy purposes)
            document.getElementById(disqus_container_id).innerHTML = '';
        });
                config.callbacks.onReady.push(function() {
            // sync comments in the background so we don't block the page
            var script = document.createElement('script');
            script.async = true;
            script.src = '?cf_action=sync_comments&amp;post_id=190532';

            var firstScript = document.getElementsByTagName( "script" )[0];
            firstScript.parentNode.insertBefore(script, firstScript);
        });
                    };
/* ]]&gt; */
           </script>
           <script type="text/javascript">
            /* &lt;![CDATA[ */
    var DsqLocal = {
        'trackbacks': [
        ],
        'trackback_url': "http:\/\/www.extremetech.com\/computing\/190532-iphone-6-and-iphone-6-plus-launch-day-teardowns-drop-tests-long-lines-and-more\/trackback"    };
/* ]]&gt; */
           </script>
           <script type="text/javascript">
            /* &lt;![CDATA[ */
(function() {
    var dsq = document.createElement('script'); dsq.type = 'text/javascript';
    dsq.async = true;
    dsq.src = '//' + disqus_shortname + '.' + 'disqus.com' + '/embed.js?pname=wordpress&amp;pver=2.74';
    (document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0] || document.getElementsByTagName('body')[0]).appendChild(dsq);
})();
/* ]]&gt; */
           </script>
          </div>

      <div class="content">
       <div class="widget column widget_execphp" id="execphp-46">
        <script type="text/javascript">
         window._taboola = window._taboola || [];
    _taboola.push({flush: true});
    
    var __ZDTABEVENT = {
        accountid : "",
        init : function(acct) {
            __ZDTABEVENT.accountid = acct;
            var divs = document.querySelectorAll("div[id^=taboola]"), i=divs.length;
            while (i--) {
                divs[i].addEventListener("click", __ZDTABEVENT.clkevt);
                __ZDTABEVENT.track(divs[i].id, "imp");
            }
        },
        clkevt : function(evt){
            __ZDTABEVENT.track(evt.currentTarget.id, "clk");


        },
        track : function(id,evt) {
            var el = document.getElementById(id);
            var placement = el.getAttribute('data-placement');
            var pagetype = el.getAttribute('data-page-type');
            if(window.ga) window.ga('send', 'event', 'Taboola', pagetype + '-' + placement, evt);
            if(window._gaq) window._gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'Taboola', pagetype+'-'+placement, evt, undefined, true]);
            if (__ZDDMP) { __ZDDMP.Event({signal:'taboola', pubid: __ZDTABEVENT.accountid, ptype:pagetype, placement:placement, evt:evt});}
        }
    };
    __ZDTABEVENT.init('ziffdavis-network15-extremetech');
        </script>
       </div>
       <div class="widget column widget_nav_menu" id="nav_menu-4">

        <!-- chartbeat -->
        <script type="text/javascript">
         var _sf_async_config = _sf_async_config || {};
/** CONFIGURATION START **/
&lt;!-- set in head --&gt;
_sf_async_config.sections = 'Computing'; 
_sf_async_config.authors ='Sebastian Anthony';
/** CONFIGURATION END **/
(function(){
function loadChartbeat()
{ window._sf_endpt=(new Date()).getTime(); var e = document.createElement('script'); e.setAttribute('language', 'javascript'); e.setAttribute('type', 'text/javascript'); e.setAttribute('src', '//static.chartbeat.com/js/chartbeat.js'); document.body.appendChild(e); }

var oldonload = window.onload;
window.onload = (typeof window.onload != 'function') ?
loadChartbeat : function()
{ oldonload(); loadChartbeat(); }

;
})();
        </script>

        <script type="text/javascript">
         jQuery(document).ready(function() {
  setTimeout(function() {
  if (jQuery("#adsense").height() &lt; 8) { 
    if (window._gaq) { window._gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'AdBlocker','Blocked' ,undefined, undefined, true]); }
    if (window.ga) { window.ga('send', 'event', 'AdBlocker', 'Blocked'); }
  } else {
    if (window._gaq) { window._gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'AdBlocker','NotBlocked' ,undefined, undefined, true]); }
    if (window.ga) { window.ga('send', 'event', 'AdBlocker', 'NotBlocked' ); }
    }
	}, 2000);
});
        </script>

  <script type="text/javascript">
   // &lt;![CDATA[
        var disqus_shortname = 'extremetech';
        (function () {
            var nodes = document.getElementsByTagName('span');
            for (var i = 0, url; i &lt; nodes.length; i++) {
                if (nodes[i].className.indexOf('dsq-postid') != -1) {
                    nodes[i].parentNode.setAttribute('data-disqus-identifier', nodes[i].getAttribute('rel'));
                    url = nodes[i].parentNode.href.split('#', 1);
                    if (url.length == 1) url = url[0];
                    else url = url[1]
                    nodes[i].parentNode.href = url + '#disqus_thread';
                }
            }
            var s = document.createElement('script'); s.async = true;
            s.type = 'text/javascript';
            s.src = '//' + 'disqus.com/forums/' + disqus_shortname + '/count.js';
            (document.getElementsByTagName('HEAD')[0] || document.getElementsByTagName('BODY')[0]).appendChild(s);
        }());
    //]]&gt;
  </script>
